Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jar
Description: Globular jar made from an orange, calcareous clay. The body is almost spherical. The mouth is very restricted and is bordered by a convex lip. The turning and polishing were well executed. This vessel is imported from Egypt and is of a well-known type during the Middle Kingdom and the Second Intermediate Period. A vessel of this type is found in almost all Classic Kerma burials.
